results.title: Racconti: La Voce del popolo = The Voice of the people
results.brief_description:
Racconti: La Voce Del Popolo (The Voice of the People) is a powerful living memory and dedication to the lives of hard working Australian/Italians and celebrates the enormous contribution they have made to this country.
Through the Digital storytelling program at the Australian Centre for Moving Image (ACMI) the 10 storytellers were guided through the telling of a personal story using multimedia tools. The participants used their voice as narrative and combined the audio-visual resources of their personal archives (photographs, video footage, text, music and sound) and each storyteller has produced a 3 - 5 minute digital story that explores their experiences of migration and settlement.
Racconti: La Voce Del Popolo (the Voice of the People) was made possible through the partnership of the Italian Federation of Migrant Workers and their Families (FILEF) and the Australian Centre for the Moving Image (ACMI) with the support of the Victorian Multicultural Commission.

results.title: Didgeridoo in Deutschland
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Take an Aboriginal musician and an Australian composer … put them in the middle of Europe and what have you got? If the composer is George Dreyfus, the musician is Richard Walley, poet and exponent of the didgeridoo, and the European country is Germany, you get a fascinating look at two individuals whose people have been persecuted but whose vastly different cultures can come together in a totally satisfying work. Made with the assistance of the Department of Aboriginal Affairs.

results.title: A meeting of ways
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Describes the process of organising a community art project for a newly-opened community centre in Melbourne called Ross House. This program records the joys, the frustrations, the tears, the highs and the lows in the making of community art.
results.description:

results.title: Old Songs in a New Land: A Piece of Jewish Australian ...
results.creator_credit: Judy Menczel, Barbara Mariotti and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Inspired by an exhibition of the same name held at Hyde Park Barracks, Sydney 1988 and organised by the Bicentennial Committee, NSW Jewish Board of Deputies, this video portrays the history of the Jews in Australia from those who arrived on the First Fleet to the Jewish immigrants from Russia of the present day. Interviews with representatives of the Jewish community highlight the differences which still exist within the community which yet retains a distinctively Jewish character.
results.title_for_label: Old Songs in a New Land: A Piece of Jewish Australian …

results.title: The Bronswick affair
results.creator_credit: Andre Leduc, Robert Awad, Rene Jodoin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A very funny yet deadly serious film, The Bronswick Affair, demonstrates the effectiveness of advertising in motivating people to buy products they don’t need. It entertains through the comic appeal of its characters and the baroque situations they fall prey to. It also lays bare some facts about the excesses of consumerism prompted by a steady flow of commercials. Nine awards including Chicago; New York; Yorkton; Columbus; Melbourne.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Andre Leduc, Robert Awad, Rene Jodoin and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Al fresco
results.creator_credit: Mario Andreacchio, Barbara Mariotti and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
In Adelaide’s Al Fresco Gelataria the young and the single meet friends, watch the passing scene of Rundle St. or strike up new relationships. Part of Adelaide’s thriving cafe society, the patrons of Al Fresco talk about their reasons for coming there, their attitude to peer groups and peer group pressure and how they relate to each other.

results.title: Saturday school
results.creator_credit: Rick Cavaggion, Georgia Allan and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
Ethnic language schools have been a part of Australia’s educational history since the 1850’s. However, until the advent of multiculturalism in the early 1970s, ethnic language schools were treated with disdain by the mainstream educational authorities who believed in assimilation programs for migrants rather than a continuing of cultural and linguistic ethnic traditions. In this video, the South Australian model for ethnic schools is investigated, including sources of financial assistance; the important work the schools do in maintaining respect for langauge and culture; and the role the schools now have in teaching new languages to children from English-speaking backgrounds.

In this video, the South Australian model for ethnic schools is investigated, including sources of financial assistance; the important work the schools do in maintaining respect for langauge and culture; and the role the schools now have in teaching new languages to children from English-speaking backgrounds.

results.title: Saigon Doctor
results.creator_credit: Georgia Allen, Kathryn Millard and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
A dramatised story of a young Vietnamese doctor who has come to Australia with his wife and child, only to find his medical qualifications are unrecognised here. He therefore enrols in a requalification course a long way from his family. As well as exploring the issue of recognition of overseas qualifications the video also focuses on the young man’s feelings of isolation, frustration, deprivation and development of a sense of community. As well as building on the social issues raised by the video, the accompanying Teacher’s notes also show how the video can be used in drama production.

results.title: The Blues Collection = Martin Scorsese presents The Blues a musical journey
results.creator_credit: Various, Reverse Angle Productions and Vulcan (US)
results.brief_description: Seven documentary films individually directed with the director’s own viewpoint on the history of blues music. The series is presented by Martin Scorsese and is described in the trailer as “a musical journey to the roots of rock, soul and hip hop”. Directors include Mike Figgis, Clint Eastwood, Charles Burnett, Wim Wenders, Richard Pearce, Rober Kenner, and Marc Levin. — [319237] Red White and Blues (Figgis) — [319233] Piano Blues (Eastwood) — [319234] Warming by the Devil’s fire (Burnett) — [319235] The Soul of a man (Wenders) — [319236] The Road to Memphis (Pearce, Kenner) — [319238] Godfathers and sons (Levin) — [319239] Feel like going home (Scosese)

results.title: Interview with Giovanni Sgro - President FILEF Australia
results.brief_description: This 30 minute interview with the president of FILEF Australia, Giovanni Sgro, was produced in ACMI’s screen pit in December of 2003. Roberta Ciabarra conducts a delightful interview with Giovanni, in which he recalls his own experience of migration and starting a new life in this country. He also provides valuable insights into the history of migrant workers and their impact on the politics and development of Australia. Created as part of the Racconti: La Voce del Popolo Digital Storytelling in association with The Italian Federation of Migrant Workers and their Families (FILEF).
